source_sentence: 作是願已，時彼一人又別乞願，願言：『藉此功德之力，於未來世，恒生大姓婆羅門家，願能誦持四惟陀論，及以六十種諸技藝等。』

source_sentence: 其優波伽摩那婆，彼時有妻，名曰摩那毘迦，端嚴可喜，觀者不厭，最勝最妙，世所無比，得優波伽摩那婆之所愛敬，若暫不見心即不悅。

translation: When the minister heard the command, he said to the king, 'I dare not disobey him.'

translation: Even though the sun's light is still blazing brightly, this is the lowest of the two kinds of affliction, and operating various businesses is called the greatest affliction.'

source_sentence: 彼優波伽作是念已，欲取刀時，更作是念：『此梵德王，於先為我作此利益，分其半國，與我共治，一切倉庫亦悉分半，我今若殺，是無恩義。』
translation: After he thought this, Upagupta then, when he wanted to take his sword, he thought again, 'This is King Bhadrika, who did this for me earlier and gave me half of his country to rule with, and who shared half of all the warehouses with me; if I were to kill him now, it would be ungrateful.'

translation: I don't need to desire this position of king, and I don't need to desire its worldly pleasures; because of this, I've developed this bad attitude; now, I can only leave home and renounce the world.'

source_sentence: 即白王言：『大王！
translation: He then said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者知我將欲捨家出家。』
translation: Now, you know that I'll want to leave home and renounce the world.'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王語優波伽：『莫作是語！
translation: "At the time, King Bhadrika said to Upāya, 'Don't say that!

source_sentence: 我既與汝分國半治，倉庫亦半，我於今者，與汝腹心，無有一人如似汝者。
translation: Since I shared half of the country with you and half of the warehouse, there's no one like you in my heart and soul.

source_sentence: 汝若出家，我今心意，定不安樂。』
translation: If you were to leave home, I would certainly be unhappy in my mind now.'

source_sentence: 其優波伽復語王言：『善哉大王！
translation: Upagupta then said to the king, 'Good, great king!

source_sentence: 願垂許我捨家出家。
translation: May you grant me permission to leave home and renounce the world.

source_sentence: 我今決定出家不疑，於我法行莫生留難。』
translation: Now, I'm determined to leave home and have no doubts, so don't make things difficult for me in my religious practice.'

source_sentence: 時，梵德王又復告彼優波伽言：『如汝所樂隨意而作。』
translation: King Bhadrika then again addressed that upāsikā, 'Do as you like.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，波羅[木*奈]城，有一瓦師，於先出家，行仙人行，依彼城住。
translation: "At the time, there was a tile maker in the city of [Pārāmaṇa] who had left home and practiced the ways of a sage and was staying there.

source_sentence: 時彼仙人，有大威德，已成五通，即能以手摸日月輪。
translation: That sage then had great authority and had developed the five supernormal powers, which enabled him to touch the sun and moon with his hand.

source_sentence: 時優波伽依彼仙人，剃除鬚髮。
translation: Upagupta then relied on that sage and shaved off his hair.

source_sentence: 既出家已，勇猛精進，即成四禪，復得五通，大有威力，亦能以手摸日月輪。
translation: After leaving home, he made vigorous effort, attained the four meditation heavens, attained the five powers, and had great authority, and was also able to touch the sun and moon with his hand.

source_sentence: 其梵德王聞優波伽捨家出家，成就大仙，有大威德，亦能以手摸日月輪，聞已微笑，入於宮內，對諸宮人，而說偈言：「『優波造善未經久，　　已獲利益果報深，　　彼仙善哉得人身，　　捨棄五欲出家行。』
translation: When the king of Brahmā Virtue heard that Upāya had left home and renounced the world, had become a great sage, had great authority, and could touch the sun and moon with his hand, he smiled upon hearing that, went into the palace, addressed the palace staff, and spoke in verse, saying, 'Upāya hasn't been making good for long, and the rewards are already deep; that sage is so good that he's attained the status of a person who has abandoned the five desires and left home to practice.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，宮人聞梵德王說是偈已，其心皆悉憂愁不樂，遂共白彼梵德王言：『大王！
translation: "After the palace officials heard King Bhadrika say this verse, their hearts were all sad and unhappy, and they all said to King Bhadrika, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，彼人本昔販賣博戲，執杖行乞，以自活命。
translation: You should know that person used to sell gambling, carry a staff, and go begging to save his own life.

source_sentence: 婆羅門人，威力尠少，是故出家。
translation: That Brāhmaṇa man's authority is limited, so he leaves home.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 今者莫學彼人捨棄家國而出家也。』
translation: Now, don't follow that person's example of renouncing your home country and leaving home.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德有剃髮師，其人名曰[口*恒]伽波羅，舊來恒可梵德王心。
translation: "At the time, there was a hair-shaver in Brahmā who was named [Mouth*Honey]Garbhadhara and who used to be a constant in the mind of King Brahmā.

source_sentence: 時，梵德王追覓喚彼剃鬚髮師，而勅之言：『[口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: The king of Brahmā then sought out the shaven-haired monk and summoned him, saying, '[Mouth*Hang]Khaparāla!'

source_sentence: 汝今為我剃治鬚髮。』
translation: Now, shave my hair and beard.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，於即睡眠。
translation: After saying this, he then fell asleep.

source_sentence: 時，剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅，見王睡已，便即剃治王之鬚髮。
translation: When the hair-shaver [Mouth*Hang] Kappala saw the king asleep, he shaved his beard and hair.

source_sentence: 如是治已，而梵德王，睡眠不覺。
translation: After he did so, King Brahmā fell asleep and didn't awaken.

source_sentence: 王後覺已，謂剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅：『我已有勅，令汝與我剃治鬚髮，云何不也？』
translation: When the king later awoke, he said to the hair-shaver [Mouth*Hang]Khaparāla, 'I've already ordered you to shave my hair, why didn't you?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，[口*恒]伽波羅白梵德王：『我已治訖，但王睡眠而不覺也。』
translation: After he said this, [Mouth*Everest]Garbhadhara said to King Brahmā, 'I've finished taming it, but the king is asleep and doesn't realize it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德取鏡自照，見己鬚髮治理已訖，見已生喜，因即勅彼[口*恒]伽波羅：『汝當受我最勝村落，我更與汝，稱意樂事。』
translation: "It was then that Brahmā took a mirror and looked at himself, saw that he had finished cutting his own hair, and became delighted at the sight.

source_sentence: 「時，剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅，白梵德王：『我共宮內王之眷屬，委曲評論，然後報王。』
translation: "The shaven-haired [mouth*high]kapāla then said to King Brahmā, 'I'll work with the king's retinue inside the palace, assigning comments to the king, and then I'll repay him.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，拜辭而去。
translation: After saying this, he bowed his head and departed.

source_sentence: 其剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅，本於王宮出入無礙，遂即入宮，白宮人言：『王已許我最勝村落以為封邑，諸后妃等，意悉云何？
translation: The hair-shaver [mouth*high]kapāla, who had been able to enter and leave the palace without obstruction, went into the palace and said to the palace staff, 'The king has granted me the most distinguished village as a feudal domain, so what do you, the queens and princesses, think?'

source_sentence: 可取已不？』
translation: Has it been taken?'

source_sentence: 爾時，妃后告彼[口*恒]伽波羅言曰：『[口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: The queen then addressed [Mouth*Honey] Kappala, saying, '[Mouth*Honey] Kappala!

source_sentence: 汝於今者何用取王最勝村落？
translation: Why do you now need to take the king's most prominent village?

source_sentence: 我等現在足能與汝金銀珍寶，但我有所囑託汝事，為我辦不？』
translation: We are now able to give you gold and silver, but is there something I have asked you to do for me?'

source_sentence: 其剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅，問宮人言：『妃等今者有何事業？
translation: The hair-shaver [Mouth*Hang] Kapila asked the palace staff, 'What are the duties of the princesses today?'

source_sentence: 令我欲辦。』
translation: 'Make me want to do it.'

source_sentence: 時諸妃等，即告彼之剃髮師言：『大王比來每入宮內，恒說一偈，作如是言：「『「優波造善未經久，　　而得利益果報深，　　　彼仙善哉得人身，　　捨棄五欲出家行。」
translation: The ladies then told their shaven-haired master, 'Whenever the king enters the palace, he always speaks a verse, saying, '"Upāya has not long been good, but he has reaped profound rewards.

source_sentence: 「『我等於時，聞王此偈，即作是念：「將恐大王捨位出家。」
translation: "'When we heard this verse from the king, we thought, 'I'm afraid the king will abandon his position and leave home.'"

source_sentence: 善哉善哉！
translation: Good, good!

source_sentence: [口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: [Mouth*Hang] Gapāla!

source_sentence: 汝至王邊，問斯偈意，其義云何？』
translation: What do you mean when you go to the king and ask what this verse means?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，[口*恒]伽波羅即往馳詣梵德王所，到已白言：『大王！
translation: "At that point, [Mouth*Honey] Kappaṭṭa went and rushed to King Brahmā, and when he arrived, he said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 許我最勝村落，我今不用如此之願。
translation: Granting me the most excellent village, I don't need to make such a vow now.

source_sentence: 但欲知王每入宮內於妃后前所說之偈：「『「優波造善未經久，　　而得利益果報深，　　　彼仙善哉得人身，　　捨棄五欲出家行。」
translation: Instead, I want to know the verse the king says whenever he enters the palace and speaks to the queen, "'Upāya hasn't long been good, but he's reaped the rewards of his efforts, and it's good that he's attained the status of a person who has abandoned the five desires and left home.'"

source_sentence: 「『善哉大王！
translation: "'Good, great king!

source_sentence: 願為我說如此偈意，其理如何？
translation: What is the rationale for wishing to expound this kind of verse for me?

source_sentence: 今從大王，乞如是願。』
translation: I now obey the great king and ask for this vow.'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王告剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅：『我聞優波伽摩那婆，捨半國位而求出家，得成仙人，有大威力，能以手掌，摩日月輪。
translation: "King Brahmadatta then addressed the shaven-haired [mouth*high]kapāla, 'I've heard that Upagamānavā, who left half his country and sought to leave home, became an immortal with such great power that he could touch the sun and moon with the palm of his hand.

source_sentence: 我今正以五欲醉亂貪著於斯，是故我今仰羨於彼，數入宮內而說是偈。』
translation: Now, I'm drunk with the five desires and addicted to them, so now I envy them and often go into their palace and say this verse.'

source_sentence: 「時，剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅，即入宮內，至妃后邊，說如是言：『諸妃后等！
translation: "The hair-shaver [mouth*Hang] Kapila then entered the palace, went to the queens, and said this, 'Queens!

source_sentence: 莫慮大王欲出家也，大王今者定不出家。』
translation: Don't worry, Your Highness, for you want to leave home; you certainly won't leave home now.'

source_sentence: 時彼后妃，聞剃髮師[口*恒]伽波羅說此語已，皆悉歡悅，心懷踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，將諸瓔珞，莊嚴己身，而告之言：『[口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: When the queen and princess heard these words from the shaven-haired master [Mouth*Everest]Gapāla, they were all delighted and overjoyed, and their hearts were filled with joy that overwhelmed them.

source_sentence: 我此瓔珞，今悉施汝，汝今更莫為活命故造作諸業。』
translation: Now, I've given you all this necklace, so don't create any more karma for the sake of living.'

source_sentence: [口*恒]伽波羅見是事已，作如是念：『彼優波伽，既捨如此半國王位，而求出家，今梵德王，仰羨於彼；我今何故不作是事，而使一切世間羨我？
translation: After [mouth*high]Kāśyapa saw this, he thought, 'Upāsikā, since he abandoned the position of king of half of the countries and sought to leave home, the king of the Brahmās now looks up to him, so why wouldn't I do this and make the whole world envy me?'

source_sentence: 然此后妃，將諸瓔珞，以施我者，我若順從此后妃意，事必不善，我於今者，亦可捨棄而從出家。』
translation: If I were to obey this queen's wish, I would surely do bad things, and I could abandon them now and leave home.'

source_sentence: [口*恒]伽波羅，作是念已，詣梵德所，而白言曰：『大王：許我以前事者，我今意樂捨棄出家。』
translation: After he thought this, [Mouth*Heart]Kappala went to Brahmā and said, 'Great king, I would gladly abandon my former position and leave home.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王而問之言：『[口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: King Brahmadatta then asked him, '[Mouth*Honey]Khaparāla!

source_sentence: 汝今意者欲於誰邊而出家也？』
translation: Now, who do you intend to leave home?'

source_sentence: [口*恒]伽波羅白言：『大王！
translation: [Mouth*Honey] Kālapāla said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我欲往至優波伽邊而出家耳。』
translation: I want to go to the edge of the Upāya valley and leave home.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，而告之言：『[口*恒]伽波羅！
translation: King Brahmadatta then addressed him, saying, '[Mouth*Hang] Kapila!

source_sentence: 如汝意見，隨願而作。』
translation: Do as you wish, as you see fit.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，[口*恒]伽波羅自剃鬚髮，至優波伽仙人之所，於即出家。
translation: "At the time, [Mouth*Honey] Kāśyapa shaved his own hair and went to the sage Upāya, where he then renounced the world.

source_sentence: 既出家已，勤劬精進，尋獲四禪及以五通，得大威神，有大威德，亦能以手摩日月輪。
translation: After leaving home, he exerted himself diligently, attained the four meditation heavens and the five supernormal powers, attained great authority and virtue, and was able to touch the sun and moon with his hand.

source_sentence: 其梵德王，既復聞彼[口*恒]伽波羅得出家已，成大神仙，有大威力，復能以手摸日月輪，聞此事已，不勝仰羨，欲求見彼。
translation: King Bhadrapāla also heard that [Mouth*Hang] Kālapāla had left home, become a great sage, had great authority, and was also able to touch the sun and moon with his hands, and after hearing this, he admired him greatly and wanted to see him.

source_sentence: 告諸臣言：『諸大臣等！
translation: He told his ministers, 'Ministers!

source_sentence: 我今欲往彼仙人所，共彼相見。』
translation: Now, I want to go to that sage and meet with him.'

source_sentence: 時諸臣等，而白王言：『大王不然！
translation: The ministers then said to the king, 'No, Your Majesty!

source_sentence: 大王今者不合身自往彼人所，我等遣使，喚彼仙來。』
translation: Now, Your Majesty, we've sent an envoy to summon those sages.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王報諸臣言：『卿等！
translation: King Brahmadatta then told his ministers, 'Gentlemen!

source_sentence: 今者應無此理，汝等莫作如是之語。
translation: "Now, there's no such thing, so don't say such a thing.

source_sentence: 上世已來，無如此法，而有諸仙，身不自在，而從喚也。
translation: In a previous life, there was no such thing, and yet there were sages who didn't have control over their bodies and were called upon.

source_sentence: 我等今者身自往彼，此是如法。
translation: Now, we're going there on our own, and this is just like the Dharma.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼仙人等，是大福田，堪受供養，我等必須身自至彼。』
translation: Those sages and others are a field of great merit and worthy of offerings, so we must go there ourselves.'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王乘自威德，莊嚴備辦五百乘車，左右圍遶，及以五百諸大臣等，從波羅[木*奈]出詣向彼諸仙人所，自欲光顯於彼世界。
translation: "Then, in his own dignified way, King Brahmā prepared five hundred chariots, surrounded them from side to side, and took five hundred ministers and others out of Bora[muṇḍinya] and headed for those sages, intending to shine their light on that world.

source_sentence: 「爾時，仙人[口*恒]伽波羅，遙見王來，及至白王：『善來梵德！
translation: "At the time, the sage [Mouth*Honey] Kāśyapa saw the king coming from a distance and said to him, 'Well done, Brahmā!

source_sentence: 希能遠至。』
translation: I hope you'll come far.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼等五百諸臣，怨恨瞋彼[口*恒]伽波羅，出麤獷言：『汝是下賤，婬女所生，穢濁不淨，恒洗垢膩，云何今日喚大王名？』
translation: "At the time, those five hundred ministers resented and angered that [mouth*high]kapāla, and they spoke harshly, saying, 'You're a lowly person, born of a promiscuous woman, defiled and impure, and always washing dirt, why are you calling the great king by name today?'

source_sentence: 「時，梵德王止彼臣言：『勿作是語！
translation: "King Brahmadatta then stopped the minister and said, 'Don't say that!

source_sentence: 仙法如是，喚人名字，但此仙人，有其戒行，有大威力。』
translation: 'Thus are the teachings of sages, which call upon the names of men, but this sage has his moral discipline and great authority.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，即向諸臣，而說偈言：「『卿等莫恨此仙人，　　此仙修行已具足，　　所有苦事能行故，　　得度一切苦怖畏，　　心既得捨一切惡，　　即非剃除及瓦師。
translation: King Brahmā addressed his ministers and spoke in verse, saying, 'Don't hate this sage, for he has fulfilled his practice, has done all the painful things, has been able to end all suffering and fear, and has abandoned all evil in his mind, which is to say that he's neither a shaver nor a tile maker.'

source_sentence: [口*恒]伽波羅已苦行，　　降伏我故喚名字，　　現得忍力汝等看，　　降伏諸根獲證果，　　得諸天人所敬重，　　即天人中最為勝。』」
translation: He has practiced austerities, subdued himself, called me by name, attained the power of patience, and you see that he has subdued his faculties and realized their fruition, has been honored by gods and humans, and is the most distinguished of gods and humans.'"

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵德王及宮內諸婇女等，於先頂禮仙人之足，却住一面，而彼五百諸大臣等，尋復頂禮彼仙人足，既頂禮已，然後復禮[口*恒]伽波羅仙人之足，次後亦禮瓦師之足。
translation: "At the time, King Bhadrika and the women in his palace bowed their heads at the feet of the sage and withdrew to one side, while five hundred ministers similarly bowed their heads at the feet of the sage.

source_sentence: 其梵德王，一面坐已，慰諸仙言：『諸尊者輩！
translation: After sitting to one side, King Brahmadeva reassured the sages, saying, 'Venerables!

source_sentence: 身體康和安隱以不？
translation: Is the body physically healthy and secure?

source_sentence: 所求活命不至勞也？
translation: What do you seek to do, not to labor for your life?

source_sentence: 無人惱亂諸仙人也。』
translation: No one disturbs the sages.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，仙等報梵德言：『如是大王！
translation: "At that point, the sages responded to Brahmā, saying, 'So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 此事須忍，但王體內安和已不？
translation: This matter must be tolerated, but has the king's internal peace been restored?

source_sentence: 一切眷屬及諸大臣，國內民庶，悉安隱不？』
translation: Are all of his retinue, his ministers, and the people of his country safe?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，彼等諸仙，為梵德王，說法教化，令心歡喜增長功德。
translation: After they said this, those sages taught King Brahmā the virtues of teaching and made his heart rejoice.

source_sentence: 時梵德王，蒙彼諸仙說法教化，令心歡喜增長功德，從坐而起，頂禮諸仙，還其本處。」
translation: After those sages taught him and made his heart rejoice and increase its merit, King Bhadrika rose from his seat, paid homage to the sages, and returned to his original place."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝等若有心疑，彼時優波伽者，其人是誰？
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, "If you have any doubt in your mind, who was that Upāsaka?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，即我身是。
translation: Don't get a different view, for it's me.

source_sentence: 「汝等比丘！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 或有心疑，彼時仙人[口*恒]伽波羅剃髮師者，其人是誰？
translation: Some minds may wonder, "Who was that sage [mouth*high]kapāla who shaved his hair?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，此優波離比丘是也。
translation: Don't take it the other way around, for this is the monk Upāli.

source_sentence: 「汝等比丘！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 或有心疑，於彼之時，梵德王者，其人是誰？
translation: Some people may wonder, "At the time, who was that person, King Brahmadatta?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，此即輸頭檀王是也。
translation: Don't take it differently; this is King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 「汝等比丘！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 或有心疑，彼時五百諸大臣等，其人是誰？
translation: Some people may have wondered, "Who were those five hundred ministers and so forth?

source_sentence: 莫作異見，即今五百比丘是也。
translation: Don't take it differently, for these are the 500 monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 於時優波離比丘，亦因我得五百大臣恭敬禮拜，并及得彼梵德王禮。
translation: At the time, the monk Upāli also had the respect and veneration of 500 ministers because of me, and he was venerated by that king of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 今亦如此，復因我得五百比丘，及輸頭檀王之所禮拜。」
translation: Now, likewise, I've been venerated by 500 monks and King Śuddhodana."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘：「汝等比丘！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "You monks!

source_sentence: 若欲善知於我聲聞弟子之中持律最者，謂優波離比丘是也。」
translation: If you want to well know that the most disciplined of my śrāvaka disciples is Upāli, that's the monk."

source_sentence: 爾時，諸比丘作是念言：「其優波離，昔作何業？
translation: The monks then had this thought, "What was Upāli's past activity?

source_sentence: 乘彼業報，生剃髮師下賤之家。
translation: Riding the results of that karma, he was born into the humble home of a hair shaver.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What other karma will he do?

source_sentence: 乘其業報，而得出家，受具足戒，獲羅漢果，今得如來授其記言：『汝諸比丘於我聲聞弟子之中，持律最者，謂優波離比丘是也。』」
translation: Riding the results of their actions, they left home, received the full set of precepts, attained the fruit of the arhat, and now the Tathāgata has given them this record, saying, 'Among my śrāvaka disciples, the monk who observes the precepts the most is Upāli.'"

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘作是語已，往詣佛所，白言：「世尊！
translation: After they said this, the monks went to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其彼長老優波離者，昔作何業？
translation: "What was the activity of that elder Upāli in the past?

source_sentence: 乘彼報故，生剃髮師下賤之中。
translation: As a result of that reward, I was born among the shaven-haired masters and their lowly peers.

source_sentence: 復作何業？
translation: What further action will he take?

source_sentence: 乘彼業故，而得出家，受具足戒，得羅漢果，即得如來授其記別，稱我聲聞弟子之中持律第一。」
translation: Riding on that activity, he left home, received the full set of precepts, attained the fruit of the arhat, and was given a distinctive mark by the Tathāgata, who called me the first among śrāvaka disciples to uphold the precepts."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告諸比丘言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, saying, "You monks!

source_sentence: 我念往昔，在於此城，有剃髮師，其人娉求稱自門戶剃髮師家娶女為妻，其後不久，產生一子。
translation: I think about a time in the past when there was a haircutter in this town who asked a man to marry a woman from his family's haircutter's house and, soon afterward, gave birth to a son.

source_sentence: 彼剃髮師，尋時遇患，雖加醫療治而不差，因其所患，乃至命終。
translation: That hair-shaver then found himself in a situation where he was suffering from an illness that couldn't be treated despite medical treatment, and because of that illness, he lived to the end of his life.

source_sentence: 既命終已，剃髮師妻，將彼童兒，付自兄弟，口告之言：『此之童兒，是汝[外*男]甥，今將相付，汝等必須教此童兒，自父本業。』
translation: After his life ended, the hair-shaver's wife gave the boy to her brothers and told them, 'This boy is your [male] nephew, and I'm going to entrust him to you; you must teach this boy his father's former trade.'

source_sentence: 彼剃髮師，聞其姊妹作是語已，受此童兒，遂便教授彼父本業。
translation: After hearing this from his sister, the hair-shaver accepted the boy and taught him his father's original trade.

source_sentence: 彼剃髮師，恒在王宮，王所敬重，每為國王，剃除鬚髮，不大在外為人剃治。
translation: That hair-shaver was always in the king's palace and was respected by the king. Every time he shaved the king's hair, he didn't often shave it for others outside.

source_sentence: 時王勅給白象一頭，任所乘馳東西南北，又給金筒，安置剃刀，及餘雜事，而勅之言：『凡無佛世，有辟支佛，猶如犀牛，獨行出時，當作利益。』
translation: The king then commanded the monk to give him a white elephant to ride east, west, north, and south, a gold bowl to put his razor in, and other chores, and he commanded him, 'In a world without buddhas, there's a pratyekabuddha, like a rhinoceros, who travels alone and makes benefits when he goes out.'

source_sentence: 尋於彼時，有辟支佛，頭鬚爪髮，悉皆長利，來到彼時剃髮師邊，而告之言：『善哉賢首！
translation: Then, a pratyekabuddha with a long, shiny head, beard, nails, and hair came to the hair-shaver and told him, 'Good, good man!

source_sentence: 願當與我剃除鬚髮。』
translation: Please shave my hair.'

source_sentence: 時剃髮師報辟支佛作如是言：『善哉大仙！
translation: The hair-shaver then reported to Pārśva saying, 'Good, great man!

source_sentence: 若欲然者，聽待明日，晨朝早來，必當與仙剃除鬚髮。』
translation: If you want that, listen until tomorrow, when you come early in the morning, and I will shave your hair with the sage.'

source_sentence: 時彼尊者辟支仙人聞此語已，尋時還去。
translation: After hearing this, that Venerable Prajñācī heard him and returned at the appropriate time.

source_sentence: 過於彼夜，晨朝起時，著衣持鉢，還復詣彼剃髮師邊，作如是言：『善哉賢首！
translation: After that night, when he rose in the morning, he put on his robe and took his bowl, went back to the haircutter, and said, 'Good, good man!

source_sentence: 今當與我剃除鬚髮。』
translation: Now, you will shave my hair.'

source_sentence: 時，剃髮師還復白彼辟支佛言：『善哉大仙！
translation: The hair-shaver then again said to that pratyekabuddha, 'Good, great man!

source_sentence: 若必然者，聽至日晚，即與仙剃。』
translation: If it's inevitable, listen until sunset, and then you'll be given a shave by an immortal.'

source_sentence: 如是乃至若日西來，還復語言：『聽待晨朝。』
translation: Thus, and even if the sun comes in the west, he again says, 'Wait until the morning.'

source_sentence: 若晨朝來，聽待日西；如是乃至，晨亦不剃，晚亦不剃。
translation: If he comes in the morning and the morning, he'll wait until the sun comes in the west; thus, he won't shave in the morning and he won't shave at night.

source_sentence: 而彼童子，見此尊者辟支仙人，或晨朝來，或日西至，日日恒爾。
translation: That boy then saw this venerable Radiant Sage, who sometimes came in the morning and sometimes came in the west, and he continued to do so day by day.

source_sentence: 見已白言：『辟支尊者仙！
translation: After he saw him, he said, 'Venerable Vaiśravaṇa!

source_sentence: 何緣故，或朝或晡恒來至此？』
translation: Why do they always come here in the morning and afternoon?'

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，向彼童子，廣說前事。
translation: Prajñāpāramitā then spoke to the boy about the previous incident in detail.

source_sentence: 「爾時，童子白仙人言：『我舅終不為仙剃髮。
translation: "At that point, the boy said to the sage, 'My uncle would never shave the sage's hair.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 恃於王宮出入自在，生憍慢故。
translation: He relies on the king's palace for his freedom to enter and leave, and he becomes proud of it.

source_sentence: 我今當為仙人剃髮。』
translation: Now, I will shave the sage's hair.'

source_sentence: 時彼童子，即為仙人剃除鬚髮。
translation: The boy then shaved off the immortal's hair.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者辟支仙人，作如是念：『今此童子，大作功德，我今當須為彼童子，光揚示現功德事相。』
translation: Venerable Pṛthivī then had this thought, 'Now, since this boy has done so much good, I must brilliantly display the merits of that boy.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，告童子言：『汝之童子！
translation: After he had this thought, he told the boy, 'Your boy!

source_sentence: 若知時者，必當持取我之鬚髮，汝於當來，有大利益。』
translation: If you know the time, you will surely take my beard and hair, and you will have great benefit in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，猶如鴈王舒其兩翅，以神通力，忽爾飛騰，乘空而去。
translation: After he said this, he was like a king of gods who spread out his two wings and with supernormal powers suddenly took flight and rode off into the sky.

source_sentence: 時彼童子，取辟支佛所剃鬚髮，置於髆上，向辟支佛生清淨心，頂戴十指，合掌作禮，即發是願：『願我當於未來世中，還值如是辟支佛尊或更勝者，彼之世尊，所有說法，願我速即悉皆知解。
translation: The boy then took the shaven hair of Pārśva and placed it on his shoulder blade, gave rise to a pure heart toward Pārśva, put his ten fingers on his head, put his palms together in prostration, and made this vow: 'May I find another one like this Pārśva or one even better in a future life, and may I quickly know and understand all of the teachings of that world-honored one.

source_sentence: 又願我更不生惡道。
translation: May I never again be born in a bad path.

source_sentence: 又願當來生生世世，恒作如此剃鬚髮師，為福田故，供養承事如是聖者。』
translation: May I always be such a shaven-haired teacher for many lifetimes to come, and may I serve and support such a holy person for the sake of a field of merit.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼城宮內，國王昇殿視事，與大國臣左右圍遶。
translation: "At the time, the king ascended to the palace to examine the affairs of the king and was surrounded by his ministers.

source_sentence: 而彼大眾，悉皆遙見彼辟支佛騰空而行。
translation: The whole crowd saw that pratyekabuddha ascend into the sky and walk around from a distance.

source_sentence: 大眾見已，白彼王言：『大王！
translation: After they saw him, the large crowd said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者甚有吉利，善得人身，如今國內福田出世。』
translation: 'This is a very auspicious, well-attained person who now appears in the domestic field of merit.'

source_sentence: 王遂仰觀，即見彼時辟支佛已，告諸臣言：『剃此辟支佛鬚髮者，大得吉利。』
translation: The king then looked up and saw the then-Prācibuddha, and he told his ministers, 'Whoever shaves the hair of this Prācibuddha will greatly merit fortune.'

source_sentence: 時彼為王治鬚髮師，因在王邊，而白王言：『如此仙人，是我能剃，更誰能也？』
translation: That man who was fixing the king's hair and beard was by the king's side, and he said to the king, 'Who else could shave the hair of such an sage, except me?'

source_sentence: 時彼童子聞此語已，即至王邊而白王曰：『大王！
translation: After hearing these words, the boy went to the king and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我舅今者虛言浪語。
translation: You should know that my uncle is lying and telling lies.

source_sentence: 我舅本不剃彼鬚髮，此既小事，猶尚妄稱：「是我剃彼仙人鬚髮。」
translation: My uncle wouldn't have shaved his hair, but this is a trifling matter, and yet he still falsely claims, 'I shaved that sage's hair.'

source_sentence: 論其實剃，即我身也。』
translation: In fact, he shaved his own body.'

source_sentence: 爾時，王所治鬚髮師訶彼童子：『咄哉癡人！
translation: It was then that the king's bearddresser reprimanded the boy, 'What a fool!

source_sentence: 汝有何力？
translation: What power do you have?

source_sentence: 能剃彼髮。』
translation: He can shave his hair.'

source_sentence: 時彼童子，於即挽出辟支佛髮，顯示大眾：『此仙人髮，我現持行，願悉知見。』
translation: The boy then pulled out Pārśva's hair and showed it to the crowd, 'This is an immortal's hair that I now hold in practice, so let's all see it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，王見如是事已，即生瞋怒，告彼恒治鬚髮師言：『咄哉癡人！
translation: "Seeing this, the king became angry and addressed the master of the permanent shave, saying, 'What a fool!

source_sentence: 汝於我邊，有如是力，今日何因虛誑我也？
translation: If you have such power in regard to me, what is the reason you're deceiving me today?

source_sentence: 汝速出國，勿住我境。』
translation: Leave the country quickly and don't stay in my land.'

source_sentence: 并即奪彼所乘白象，及治鬚髮諸具度等，及以封祿與彼童子，而勅之言：『從今日後，汝恒與我治其鬚鬢及以爪甲。』
translation: He then took the white elephant he was riding, fixed his hair and beard, gave the boy his royalty, and commanded him, 'From this day forward, you will always come with me to fix his hair and beard and put on his fingernails and armor.'

source_sentence: 時彼童子而白王言：『如王所勅，不敢違也。』
translation: The boy then said to the king, 'As the king has commanded, I dare not disobey you.'

source_sentence: 從爾已後，恒即為王，治其鬚鬢及爪甲等。
translation: From then on, he would always be the king's servant, fixing his hair and beard and fixing his fingernails.

source_sentence: 隨世壽命，取終之後，因彼功德，生生世世，不墮惡道。
translation: After taking their lifetimes and reaching their end, because of their merits, they'll be born from generation to generation and won't fall into a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 從天至人，從人至天，二處往返。
translation: He'll travel from heaven to humans and from humans to heaven, going back and forth from both places.

source_sentence: 後於一時，還生在於波羅[木*奈]城剃髮師家，可喜端正，觀者不厭。
translation: At some point later, he'll be born again at the shaver's house in Pola [Munai], where he'll be pleasing and correct, and people won't tire of watching him.

source_sentence: 而彼童子，父母養育，及其長大，意智漸漸，技藝成就。
translation: That boy was raised by his parents, and when he grew up, his mind gradually became knowledgeable, and he accomplished his skills.

source_sentence: 「爾時，迦葉世尊出現於世，怛他伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，作大教師，應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: "At the time, the Bhagavān Kāśyapa appeared in the world as a tathāgata, an arhat, or samyak-saṃbuddha who was a great teacher, an offering, a correct omniscience, the feet of insight and practice, a good passing, a worldly understanding, an unsurpassed person, a tamer, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, and a world-honored one.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉婆伽婆、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，已轉法輪逆轉流轉，已受法輿本願具足，最得稱利勝丈夫志，開敷示現所化蓮華，於無量億百千眾生，安置善道。
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa Bhagavān, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha, who had turned the Dharma wheel and was in reverse transmigration, had received the Dharma mudrā, had fulfilled his past vows, and was most accomplished in praising his superior aspirations, opened and showed the lotus that he had created, placing measureless hundreds of millions of sentient beings on the good path.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，修行依彼波羅[木*奈]城，住舊仙人所居之處彼鹿苑中，與比丘僧二萬人俱。
translation: At the time, he was cultivating his practice based in that city of [Mokṣala] and staying in that deer park where the sages used to live, accompanied by 20,000 monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 時彼剃治鬚髮師父，數至彼苑，與諸比丘剃除鬚髮。
translation: That master shaver came to the park often, and he and the monks shaved off their hair.

source_sentence: 然彼小兒，始能行時，共父至於伽藍寺內。
translation: When that boy was first able to walk, he went with his father to the Kālāma monastery.

source_sentence: 然諸比丘，或說諸法，講論之時，得至彼聽講說律時，或復得聽，或不得聽。
translation: However, when those monks were teaching the Dharma or giving discourses, they could come to listen to the preaching of the Vinaya, or they could hear it again, or they couldn't hear it.

source_sentence: 時彼童子，問諸比丘：『云何一切等是善言，我或得聞，或不得聽。
translation: The boy then asked the monks, 'Are these things good words that I might hear or might not hear?

source_sentence: 其意如何？』
translation: What do you think?'

source_sentence: 時諸比丘報言：『童子！
translation: The monks then reported, 'Boy!

source_sentence: 如此之法，是諸比丘祕密之事，若不受於具足戒者，悉不得聽。』
translation: Such teaching is a secret matter of monks, and no one who doesn't accept the full set of precepts may hear it.'

source_sentence: 時彼童子聞此事已，心生懊惱：『云何願我速得出家，堪聞善語？』
translation: After hearing this, the boy was distressed, 'How would I like to quickly leave home and be able to hear good words?'

source_sentence: 後時童子至律師邊，請乞出家，得受具戒，依諸比丘誦持戒律，依法而行，雖復如此，而不得證出世之智。
translation: The boy then went to the vinaya master, asked to leave home, received the full set of precepts, recited the precepts according to the monks, and practiced according to the rules; even though he did so, he couldn't realize supramundane cognition.

source_sentence: 然彼後時，病困著床，臨欲命終，又發是願：『迦葉如來、怛他伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，有一菩薩，名曰護明，已授記言：「汝於將來，壽百年世，當得作佛，號曰釋迦多他伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀。」
translation: However, later, when he was sick and tied to his bed, he was about to die and made this vow: "Kāśyapa Tathāgata, Trāyastriṃśa Buddha, there's a bodhisattva named Hupo-myō who has given you this assurance, 'In the future, when you've lived a hundred years, you will become a buddha, and you will be called Śākyamuni, Trāyastriṃśa Buddha.'

source_sentence: 我於今者，願值將來釋迦牟尼，若順所願，在彼教中，亦乞出家，受具戒已，於彼世尊諸弟子中，所持律者，我為第一。
translation: Now, I wish to meet the future Śākyamuni and, if I follow his wishes, beg to leave home within his teaching and receive the full set of precepts, and I'll be the best among his disciples in terms of observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 如我今日，此師和上，於迦葉佛諸持律行弟子之中，最為第一；我亦如是，當於彼時釋迦如來法教之中，持律弟子，我最第一。』
translation: As I am today, this teacher and superior was the best among Kāśyapa Buddha's disciples who observed the precepts, and so will I be the best among the disciples of the Tathāgata's teaching who observe the precepts.'

source_sentence: 彼人從爾，命終已後，即生天上，及至今日，最後之身，受胎生於迦毘羅城剃髮師家，名優波離，即其人也。
translation: From then on, after his life ended, he was born up in the heavens, and now, in his final body, he was born in the womb to a shaven-haired master in Kapilavastu, named Upāli, which is that person.

source_sentence: ◎佛本行集經卷第五十四
translation: ◎佛行集經卷第五十四
